name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-878
Reason: 1E-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine has a melting point that we will predict by considering its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have substantial structural components to consider. The hydroxyl group can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 °C. The methyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +2 °C. The bicyclic system in the molecular structure can also contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20 °C for each additional fused ring. Additionally, the imine group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +10 °C.
